scene.name: intro
scene.line: Hey, kid. What do you think of these little trees?
scene.option: I think they need better light.

scene.name: trees-smell-good
scene.line: Yeah, they do, don't they. She's got good taste in aromatic plants, that captain. Keeps the boat smelling fresh.

scene.name: trees-light
scene.line: Yeah, good point. I wonder how they live down here. Maybe she's got a special light bulb in here she turns on in the daytime.

scene.name: about-trees
scene.line: When I was a kid — older than you, a teenager, I guess — we used to shoplift beer and go drink it in this one cemetery, they had a bunch of trees like this. Bigger, though. We used to call them "pencil pines."

I asked Cate about them, and she said these were probably the same species. A lot of people put them in cemeteries. If you cut a branch off one of these, it won't grow back, so I guess that reminds people of the permanence of death.
Anyway, we never knew about that when I was a kid. We used to snap the branches off and whip each other with them.
